summary: The 'Sanction Transactions Originating from Pernicious Chinese Companies and Policies Act of 2025' (STOP CCP Act of 2025) aims to restrict U.S. investments in Chinese companies operating in sensitive sectors, specifically those linked to defense, surveillance technology, or the military-industrial complex. It prohibits the purchase or sale of securities from these companies and expands the Non-Specially Designated Nationals Chinese Military-Industrial Complex Companies List. The bill also addresses sanction loopholes and includes provisions for presidential waivers based on national security interests.
